runs.comm: What a start! We have a spinner to start proceedings and what's more we have a wicket first ball. Arm-ball, first up, coming in quickish with the arm, on the middle stump line and Sibanda doesn't pick it up at all. He has a hurried stab but can't prevent the ball from going on to hit the stumps. Clatterrrrrrrrr!
around the off stump line, dabbed away to the off side
leans forward to work it to square-leg region
another one coming in with the arm, goes past the defensive prod and strikes the pad. Going down, leg side though
flighted fuller outside off stump, the batsman goes for the sweep, misses and is hit on the pad outside off stump
And again. Super over this from Benn. Maiden wicket. What a fab start for West Indies
cuts in from just outside off stump, from a length, moves past the prod and hits the thigh pad. Beaten for pace and movement
Another fine delivery, this one just about holds its line outside off and the batsman is beaten, pushes inside the line
full length delivery, pushed out to cover
in the zone outside off stump line, Masakadza goes for a square drive on a bent knee and can't connect
Yet another maiden over. Masakadza goes for the big swing outside off stump and misses. Whoosh.......
Taibu keeps going for the sweep shot and keeps missing them. Another one that strikes him outside off stump

Trapped! That attempt to play the sweep shot again proves fatal this time. The ball is really full and is hit on the pad in front of middle and off stump line. It would have hit the leg stump. Gone! What a roaring start from Benn
Pandemonium! Benn is da man! This one just about straightens outside off stump and the batsman goes for a iffy drive and edges it to Ramdin. This is an unbelievable start from West Indies.
Now Taylor goes for the sweep and is hit on the pad. Nervous and edgy
turns away from the off stump, pushed away to the off side
gets forward to jab the length delivery
in the channel outside off stump, goes for a punchy drive and is beaten
Stop the press. Zimbabwe get a run on the board. He leans forward to drive it wide of mid-on
Shot! Full pitched outside off stump, Masakadza goes down on his knee to play a flamboyant hit over covers. Bang!

Oh the off stump has been knocked out but it's a no ball. Loverly off cutter, moves back in from outside off stump, very sharp movement, and rushes through the bat and pad gap to crash into the off stump
Huge swing and a miss. Another off cutter and the ball bounces past the stumps
pushes this one through point
just outside off stump line, goes for the cut and is beaten
flighted fuller outside off stump, goes for the big off drivee and squeezes it out past point

What is happening out there? U N B E L I E V A B L E !  Benn flights one on a length, on the middle stump line and Taylor plays all around it. I can't believe what's happening. Benn is bowling fine all right but the Zimbabwe are treating it as he is bowling some grenades out there. Poor effort from them. Credit to Benn of course but very poor cricket from Zimbabwe
leans forward to defend
leans forward to push it to the off side
again gets forward to defend to the off side
pushes this one through the off side for a single
outside off stump, run down to third man
length delivery, bounces as it cuts back in, steered to backward point
fuller, around off stump line, pushed out to mid-on
back of length, just outside off stump, tapped to backward point
Goes for the good slog to a delivery outside off stump and doesn't connect
floated full outside off stump, mistimes a drive to the off side
leans forward to play the sweep shot. Is it the first sweep shot that has connected?!
gets forward to turn it away for a single
leans forward to defend
sharp turn there! It broke away from the middle and off and spun past the edge
in the channel outside off stump and the batsman is comprehensively beaten
on the middle and leg stump line, Lamb stays back to defend
bouncing delivery on the pads, bounces past the attempted glance and runs away off the thigh pad to fine-leg boundary
really full delivery outside off stump, almost yorker length, tries to dig it out but can't put bat to ball
cuts in from outside off stump, moves past the defensive jab to hit the back thigh and rolls away behind the wicket
outside off stump, run down to third man
slower one outside off stump, slightly early into the drive, the ball stops on him and ends up jabbing it away
gets forward to push this one to the off side
slightly slower outside off stump, Masakadza waits on the front foot, opens the bat-face and it runs off the edge through the vacant slip region
goes for the big hit over midwicket, misses and is struck on the body
slower one outside off stump, tapped past point
length delivery on the middle and off line, pushed to the on side
in the zone outside off stump, goes for a cut but is cramped for room by the inward movement and is beaten
Masa breaks free with a lofted hit over mid-on. He thrust his front foot out and just knifed through the line. Up and over.
climbs from short of length, defended to the off side
on the pads, rolls away to short fine-leg region
on the middle and leg, swatted past square-leg
fullish, on the stumps, turned wide of midwicket
slower one, off cutter around middle stump line, defended on the front foot
short and outside off, cut to deep point
bowls it from well behind the wicket but pushes it wide outside off
gets forward and has a big swing across the line but makes no contact
connects this time and gets a single down to deep midwicket
on the middle stump line, dabbed to backward square-leg
in the zone outside off, Lamb goes for the big cut shot but can't put bat to ball
climbs outside off, Lamb just opens the bat-face and runs it very late to third man
length delivery on the middle stump line, jabbed out to cover
on the middle and leg, rolls away towards square-leg
slower one, full, mistimes the drive to mid-off
slower one, on the pads, turned to short fine-leg fielder
slower one on the off stump line, turned past square-leg for a single
back of length outside off stump, mistimes a punchy drive to cover
walks down the track, mistimes the lofted hit towards long-on..
walks right across the stumps, works the ball from outside off to midwicket
outside off stump, cut to backward pount
shortish delivery, pulled away to deep midwicket
full delivery down the leg side, brushes the pad en route to the keeper
Fabulous strike. He picked the slower one early, waited on the front foot, went down on his knee and as he swung the ball over wide long-on. Crash!
gets forward to push it away for a single to the leg side
full length delivery outside off, square-driven for a single
walks across to the off stump line and works it past square-leg

The middle stump has been knocked out of its peg and the puzzling thing is there was no reason why it should have happened! It was slightly slower one all right but jeez not enough to produce a lame dismissal like this. Lamb just seemed to sort of very lazily, very very lazily, poked at the delivery - perhaps he thought he would late cut the delivery- and just didn't connect. It seemed he just let it go ... sort of a shot you play in a video game where you are unsure and got struck while pressing the buttons and the ball just knocks your stumps out
gets forward to push it away for a single
wide down the leg side
turns this one to square-leg
walks across to the off stump but this one is a slower one that slips down the leg side
walks down the track and jabs it off the inner edge to backward square-leg
punches this one down to long-off
Edged ... short in length and outside off stump, Masakadza goes for the cut and gets the edge and Ramdin dives but can't quite get to it
pushes this one to cover point
length delivery outside off stump, punched away to long-off
gets this from outside off and laps it around the corner to short fine-leg
slower one outside off stump, full, swung towards long-on
goes for the yorker, dug out and pushed down to long-off
pulls this one away to the on side for a single
low dipping full toss, flicked away for a single
yorker on the off stump line, dug out to cover
low full toss on the middle, played towards sweeper cover

short in length outside off stump, goes for the slog across the line, is beaten by the change in pace and edges it to his pad. Roach rushes across to kick the ball to stumps at the striker's end but kicks it past the off stump and has a big smile!
yorker outside off stump, it whooshes past the blade and to Ramdin
another one nearly at the blockhole, dug out towards long-on
the slow yorker, on the off stump line, jabbed out to the off side
picks the full delivery from outside off and swings it to long-on
really full delivery around off, driven down to long-off

Done in by the slower off cutter. It was in the channel outside off, Masakadza went across the line for a big hit but gets a thin edge and Ramdin takes a neat catch. What's that cliche? Ah got it - "they are never easy"!
short in length outside off stump, punched to sweeper cover
driven through the off side for a single
low full toss on the leg stump line and it has been pulled away to the boundary

mistimes the shot towards long-on and they see the chance to come back for the second run as the ball rolled just past mid-on region .. the throw comes in to the right of Rampaul who is unable to collect cleanly. Had he done so, he could have easily run out Cremer
full and outside off, swing and a miss. No ball again, though
low full toss outside off stump, slashed off the outer edge to third man
low full toss outside off, sliced away for a single
Yet another no ball from Rampaul and this one has been thrashed to the cover boundary. Full delivery outside off and hit over extra cover
Thump! Full toss on the middle and leg and Chigumbura flays it over midwicket boundary.
full delivery, another big drive attempted but it runs off the inner edge to short fine-leg fielder.
full, straight and Cremer loses his middle stump as he swings across the line. Poor over from Rampaul but he ends with a wicket.
Thwack! Chigumbura you beauty! Full pitched delivery just outside off and Chigumbura went down town. He cleared the front foot and swung it straight .. . up .. up and over
short in length,  a touch slower, just outside off, Chigumbura goes for the flat-batted pull, the bottom-hand comes off the handle and the ball balloons off the edge to cover
moves outside leg stump, goes for the big swing across the line and misses
Caught at long-on. He had to go for the big hit and he went and connected pretty well actually .. but caught at the ropes.
sprays this one down the leg side
Five-for for Sammy! Oh what a day for him. He got this to cut back in from outside off stump and it rushed through the bat and pad gap to hit the stumps.
